body_html: Yeah I think there's little point in warning that we can't use cuDNN if you're not even asking for it. I can't see a problem with implementing at::warn that would dispatch to a callback (this logic lives in a single place).
body_text: Yeah I think there's little point in warning that we can't use cuDNN if you're not even asking for it. I can't see a problem with implementing at::warn that would dispatch to a callback (this logic lives in a single place).
body: Yeah I think there's little point in warning that we can't use cuDNN if you're not even asking for it. I can't see a problem with implementing `at::warn` that would dispatch to a callback (this logic lives in a single place).
